html:
The Lord of the Rings has maintained its cultural significance since the 1950s through books, movies, and now television, expanding a fandom that stretches across generations, which makes it an excellent starting point as you shop for the One Gift this holiday season.

There’s no shortage of options for the Lord of the Rings fans in your life, so we’ve narrowed down the best gifts across different areas of interest, from must-have movie and book sets to collectibles of all kinds.

Gifts for Fans of the Books

The Lord of the Rings Illustrated

The full The Lord of the Rings saga with illustrations by Tolkien.

Our top pick for Lord of the Rings readers is this gorgeous 1,248-page compilation of the full trilogy featuring 30 maps and sketches illustrated by Tolkien himself. With unique cover art and red-sprayed edges, this edition of Tolkien’s fantasy saga is an eye-catching addition to any bookshelf that holds within it one of the greatest and most beloved works of fantasy.

Gifts for Fans of the Movies

Our Top Pick is up for Pre-order

The Lord Of The Rings Trilogy: One Ring Gift Box

Extended cuts of all three The Lord of the Rings movies with a replica One Ring.

Our top pick is a new release this holiday season (officially out on December 20). This collection bundles the theatrical and extended cuts of all three Lord of the Rings movies with faux-leather packaging and a high-quality replica of the One Ring engraved with the same Elvish text seen in the book/movies: “One Ring to rule them all, One Ring to find them, One Ring to bring them all and in the darkness bind them.”

The Hobbit Trilogy Blu-ray

The extended editions of all three The Hobbit movies in one package.

Prime Video

This membership grants access to Prime Video, the exclusive place to watch the new Lord of the Rings television series, The Rings of Power.

Gifts for Fans of LEGO

LEGO Icons The Lord of The Rings: Rivendell

LEGO Icons set depicting the Elven settlement Rivendell.

The top Lord of the Rings LEGO set this holiday season is a majestic depiction of the Elven settlement Rivendell, complete with 15 minifigures and movable models of key locations like Frodo’s bedroom and the Council of Elrond. The 6,167-piece set is sure to keep its new owner busy well into the season. Kevin Wong, LEGO fanatic and builder, said the LEGO set is "an epic tribute to Fellowship" froom his LEGO build guide from earlier this year.

Other top LOTR LEGO picks are shown below, including Barad-dûr as the second massive-scaled set that LEGO has designed around the Lord of the Rings movie trilogy.

LEGO Icons The Lord of the Rings: Barad-dûr

For the serious LEGO lover in your life, this 5,471-piece set of the Dark Tower stands 32.5” tall and includes 10 character minifigures, including Sauron, Frodo, and Gollum.

LEGO BrickHeadz Gandalf the Grey & Balrog

A more reasonably priced option for Lord of the Rings fans is this 348-piece set of Gandalf and a balrog, calling back to the duo’s battle in The Fellowship of the Ring.

LEGO BrickHeadz Aragorn & Arwen

Alternatively, LEGO offers this 261-piece set of heroic lovers Aragorn and Arwen.

For more LEGO, see what's on sale from LEGO Black Friday already.

Gifts for Fans of Board Games

War of the Ring

An advanced Lord of the Rings strategy game for 2 to 4 players.

Our top pick is the perfect gift for experienced board game players. War of the Ring is an expertly crafted, fairly advanced strategy game for 2–4 people that pits the armies of the Free Peoples against those of the Shadows in a battle for Middle-earth.

Gifts for Fans of Magic the Gathering

Lord of the Rings Two-Deck Starter Kit

Magic the Gathering starter kit including two Lord of the Rings-themed decks.

The Lord of the Rings starter kit provides two gifts in one: the cards themselves and the ability to immediately jump into the game with two ready-to-play, 60-card decks. It’s a great value at $20, and it’s our top pick for those looking to learn the ins and outs of MtG with a friend. Be sure to also see the best Magic the Gathering gift list which also includes these LOTR highlights!

Tales of Middle-earth Scene Boxes

A memorable gift for MtG collectors, these boxes include six foil borderless cards that combine to create scenes from The Lord of the Rings. Also included is a display easel to showcase the six-card scene and three booster packs to boot.

Tales of Middle-Earth Riders of Rohan Commander Deck

This product contains everything one needs to start playing the Commander format: a regulation-sized deck (100 cards) led by Aragorn and Éowyn, a two-card Collector Booster Sample pack, a life tracker, deck box, and more.

Tales of Middle-earth Set Booster Box

For the MtG fanatic in your life, the Tales of Middle-earth set booster box includes 30 Lord of the Rings-themed packs.

More from MtG:

Gifts for Collectors

Limited Edition The Fellowship Plaque

A collector's Lord of the Rings plaque limited to 5,000.

Straight from IGN Store, this collector’s plaque and display stand is limited to 5,000, making for a unique Lord of the Rings gift your recipient isn’t likely to find elsewhere. The metal plaque displays an outline of the Fellowship on the front and an inscription of a timeless Gandalf quote on the back: “All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us.”

Limited Edition Mordor Medallion

This Mordor Medallion, another true collector’s item limited to 5,000, includes a display stand and map of Middle-earth. Also available in the IGN Store: Elven and Gondor Medallions.

Green Elven Mug

For the coffee or tea drinker in your life: an officially licensed Lord of the Rings mug inscribed with Elven text.

Bendable Sauron Figure

This affordable figure of the Dark Lord Sauron stands at 7” tall. Its detail makes it worthy of displaying, while its detachable base and bendable limbs make it equally well-suited for play.

As Black Friday ramps up and the biggest deals on just about everything drops in November, it's an ideal time to do some holiday shopping for gifts right now. Whether you shop ahead of time or are just getting ideas, IGN has some truly fun gift guides for 2024 holiday season. Check out our guides so far on our gift shopping guides' page all throughout November (and December), which includes top Harry Potter gifts and our favorite gift cards to give and receive.

Jordan covers games, shows, and movies as a freelance writer for IGN.
